Fields.DialogueText: All crew, report to me!
We're not just going to defeat this approaching Morgana; we're going to eviscerate her. Does everyone understand me?
Excuse me, Audacieux? Would you mind letting me give the orders?
Excuse you indeed! Who do you think you are?
I'm the captain of the ship, Audacieux. We've met before.
Well, you're too late, Capitaine. As you were unavailable, I gave the order to engage the Morganas up ahead. Next time, don't take so long to join the party.

Fields.MenuText: Fair enough. It was the right call.
I wasn't unavailable - I just wasn't here yet. Next time, find me first.
Why did you give those orders without me?

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine. You should leave this to me.
It's inefficient - but if you insist. And if the circumstances permit.
Someone needed to. If I see a job that isn't being done, I jump into action. That's just what I do.
I'll take over from here.
Mar plij. If you think you can handle it.
I can already tell we're in for a... time.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, permission to enter?
Most people ask for permission before they're already inside.
I was just cutting out the middleman, Capitaine. We both know you weren't going to turn me away.
Actually, I might have. I have a mountain of paperwork I need to get through.
This can't wait, Capitaine. There's danger in the water.

Fields.MenuText: You mean, there are Morganas approaching? Why hasn't the alarm sounded?
What kind of danger are you talking about?
The Morganas couldn't have waited until after I finished this paperwork?

Fields.DialogueText: The Morganas are always out there, Capitaine. We must always be on watch.
The Morganas, Capitaine. What war do you think we're fighting?
Oh, I'm sooooo sorry. I'll be sure to let them know about your grievances.
I'll be right there.
Hurry up. You wouldn't want to be late again.
@BATTLE
Where have you been, Capitaine? I requested to speak with you some time ago.
Audacieux, I can't always drop everything I'm doing and come running when you call. I'm here now, so what do you need?
We're at war, damn it! We don't have time for your lectures.
Yes, we're at war, on that we can agree. But the message that you wanted to see me didn't suggest any specific problems. Ensign O'Brien just said you've been extremely uneasy.
Ya. There's something... something. We should be on high alert.

Fields.MenuText: No need to be on alert. Though I do think it's time for you to take a break. We don't want you exhausting yourself.
High alert, huh? Then I suppose you wouldn't mind overseeing the watch tonight.
If it will make you feel better, I'll wait with you here. Help keep an eye out.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need a break, Capitaine. I've already had my two hours of sleep for the night.
Fine by me. I'll do a better job than most of the men aboard this boat.
Excellent, Capitaine. You won't have to wait long before I'm proven right. I'm certain.
Okay. We'll keep our eyes open. But, Audacieux, much as I respect a bit of paranoia in wartime, you need to get some rest and try to-
Capitaine, shut up and look at the water.
That... okay, that's a submarine. And I will never discount paranoia again. Sound the alarms.
Oui, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
Well, Capitaine, perhaps in the future you'll be less hasty with words like "paranoia" and "crazy."
I did not call you crazy. I may have been thinking it, but I made sure not to say it.
Well, you said it now!
All right, you got me. I'm sorry. Honestly, I'm thankful that you're so dedicated to looking after the ship. It's admirable.
Well... I mean... I am the ship, but... merci, Capitaine. Trugarez.
You're welcome.
So... How's your day been?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I guess it's been fine.
Haven't been sleeping well. War does a number on your nerves.
I never took you as one for small talk, Audacieux.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear it. It must be due to our recent victory.
Unfortunate dreams? That's a shame to hear, Capitaine.
Fine. I was just trying to have a pleasant conversation with you, but I know how to take a hint.
Audacieux, we might need to have a conversation at some point. Your behavior, especially during battle can be a little-
No more time for frivolous talk, Capitaine. We have Morganas approaching from the south.
Of course we do.
@BATTLE
Audacieux, are you free for a moment?
For you, I'm free for the day, Capitaine. What do you need from me?
What are... Why don't you... Is there a reason you-
Cat got your tongue, Capitaine?
I can see... A lot more than I'm used to seeing, Audacieux.
What better way to enjoy the sun than by tanning? And no one likes an uneven tan.
Seriously? Do you think you could put on something more.... More?
Are you blushing, Capitaine? Are you embarrassed? Is that the real reason you want me covered up?
I just don't want my crew getting distracted while they're supposed to be working. That ensign over there is going to fall over the side of the ship trying to get a better view.
Nope. Nann. I don't understand at all.
Yes, you do. You're just pretending you don't. This is what I'm talking about.
Talking about?
We're supposed to be working together, Audacieux. But I can't help but notice that you sometimes... What's a good word for it? You can be discourteous.
Discourteous? I think I prefer the word cheeky. It's more fitting.
Whatever word you use, it doesn't promote a healthy relationship. I need to know I have your support.

Fields.MenuText: Can I count on you?
What can we do to better work together?
So quit arguing with me all the time.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course you can count on me, Capitaine. Honestly, I don't know why you'd think otherwise. I just don't see it.
I think we work together just fine. But if you want to improve it, you could stop being a prude about me sunbathing on deck.
Capitaine, if you think that's arguing then you are sorely mistaken. It's just a difference of opinion. Your opinions are wrong and mine are right. Like now.
Audacieux, are you hearing a word I'm saying?
Every single ridiculous one.
*ALARM*
But I can also hear that alarm.
Let's just get to work.
Just a moment. If we're going into battle, I should put something on.
@BATTLE
Bof! You're exaggerating.
I'm making a point. Do you understand?
Man your stations and follow my lead! They've strayed too far this day!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, how'd you feel about that last battle? I performed admirably, nann?
Of course, Audacieux. You're capable and quick. Exactly what we need when we're fighting these Morganas.
So... You're saying I'm perfect. Thank you. That's what I needed to hear.
Did you ask me that simply to get some praise from me?
Digarezit ac'hanon? I stopped listening after you complimented me.
Mm-hm, that checks out.
Well, anyhow, I need to find Ensign O'Brien. Have you seen him?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not even sure who that is.
No, I haven't seen him. He could be hiding from you.
Have you checked the mess?

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't be. He's just a small time officer. No one, really.
Hiding from moi? Why ever would he do that? I'm a delight.
Well, not yet. I just started looking, but that would be the obvious place to start.
If you see him, Capitaine, tell him to track me down.
I suppose I can do that. Just remember I'm-
-The captain, not your messenger. Then why do I act like it sometimes?
Merde, merde, merde!
You sound rattled, Audacieux. And in French, not Breton.
Excuse me, I do not get rattled. I'm simply...
At a loss for words?
Have you seen O'Brien yet?
Not yet. Is there something urgent you need him for?
Merde, merde, merde!

Fields.MenuText: If something's wrong you should tell me, Audacieux.
You'll track him down eventually. The ship isn't that big.
Do you need someone to help you find him? I can assign an officer to-

Fields.DialogueText: It's nothing you should concern yourself with, Capitaine. I have it under control.
Right... He'd just better show his face soon. I'm running out of patience.
No! I mean, I appreciate that you would go to the trouble, but I can find him myself.
On a separate note, I need to go over the plans from our last strategy meeting. Where did you put them?
I didn't put them anywhere, Capitaine. Did you misplace them? You can be forgetful sometimes.
Really? I thought for sure you had them...
*ALARM*
Oh! Look at that. We've got some Morganas to destroy. Come on, Capitaine, let's go!
I'm coming. You don't have to pull me along by the arm.
@BATTLE
No, they're not here. And not here either. Hmm...
Looking for something, Capitaine?
Still trying to find those plans. I can't remember for the life of me where they were. Maybe I am getting forgetful...
Hmm. Well, that is indeed a problem. You're a bright person, though. If anyone can find them, it's you.
Did you just compliment me? You never compliment me.
Digarezit ac'hanon? Sure I do. All the time. You're very easy to flatter.

Fields.MenuText: You're seeming a little off. Are you okay?
Well, it's about time you noticed.
You're hiding something. I don't know what, but you're hiding something.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm perfectly fine. Just enjoying being in your presence. You smell terrific, by the way. Is that a new shampoo?
Oh, I've always noticed. You walk into a room, and the first thing people notice is the aura of magnificence that you emanate.
You're right. I've been hiding my affection for you. I think... I think I'm in love with you!
Okay, now I know you're up to something, Audacieux. The typical, brash Audacieux would be slinging insults my way.
That hurts, Captain. I try to come off as less insulting and just more catty.
You wouldn't happen to know anything about these plans? Would you, Audacieux?
Okay... Look, I didn't want it to come down to this, but...
*ALARM*
Damn it! This isn't over, Audacieux. We'll finish this discussion when the Morganas have been dealt with.
I never thought I'd be rooting for the Morganas.
@BATTLE
This battle is intense! Maybe this will be enough to distract.... Nann!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I'm coming clean.
Audacieux, I didn't mean right after the Morganas were dealt with. We're still catching our breath after that battle. The smell of gunpowder is still in the air.
So you're saying you don't want to talk anymore?

Fields.MenuText: You're not getting off that easy. You can talk while I review these battle reports.
It's not the best time, but if you have something you need to say, you should tell me now.
When has my ever telling you not to do something stopped you?

Fields.DialogueText: Quite the multitasker, aren't you?
Thanks, Capitaine. I think it's important that I get this off my chest.
That is an excellent point, Capitaine. I'll go on then.
The reason I've been looking for O'Brien... I misplaced those documents you've been looking for. I think I saw him with them.
And you still haven't found him?
Nann. I talked it over with a few of the other officers... We think he may have deserted.
And instead of telling me immediately, you let me go on thinking I lost them myself? I don't have the words to explain how... angry I am right now.
I wanted to find him on my own! I didn't think I needed your help to track down one little traitor.
That's not important anymore. We need to track down those plans. We can't let them get into the wrong hands!
On that we can agree.
I'll contact the Protection Force, give them a heads up. Maybe they've heard about stolen plans trying to be sold to our enemies.
The greed of some people knows no bounds.
... This is one of those things you were talking about, right? Me being discourteous and not fostering a healthy partnership between us?
This is leagues beyond discourteous, but we can discuss that later. We have larger matters to deal with.
Ya, Capitaine.
I'm right here, you know.
With classified documents.
Ya. Maybe.
So, O'Brien didn't leave any clues as to where he might be headed? Or who he was betraying us for?
I've already looked into that, Capitaine. He disappeared without a trace.
The Protection Force isn't happy. Having traitors on their ship doesn't exactly foster trust between the participating nations.
Plus, if we can't track O'Brien down, we'll have to start over from scratch. Who knows who could be reading our plans?
This is just getting worse and worse!

Fields.MenuText: You should've told me about all this earlier. I might've been able to help.
We should put word out to all nearby ships. Someone may have given him passage without knowing he's a fugitive.
Well, there's one possibility we haven't considered yet... Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Anything you could've thought to do, Capitaine, I have already tried.
That's a good idea. O'Brien wasn't exactly a master of disguise. He should be easy to spot.
You think he could have defected to the Morganas? Would they even work with him?
Whatever we do next, we have to do it fast. Every second we waste is a second he puts between us.
There aren't just seconds between us. We have Morganas approaching. Seems like they're looking for a fight.
Let's give it to them.
@BATTLE
Good news, Capitaine! There's been a sighting of O'Brien. We know where he should be heading.
Fantastic. What's our destination, then?
He was last seen heading straight into Morgana territory. I think he must've really gone crazy and defected to the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Or, at least, he's about to. The question is why?
Could he have been under Morgana control all along?
Maybe he's just going in the wrong direction? He wasn't a navigator.

Fields.DialogueText: Who knows? I still say he lost his marbles.
Uhhh... I doubt it. That's... Actually, something like that would be seriously scary.
Lost? Nann. He's trying to side with the Morganas, I just know it. The coward!
Whatever the reason he's doing this, we have to stop him.
Straight into Morgana territory, then?
You guessed it.
@BATTLE
We're moving out, everyone! I want us moving faster than we've ever moved before. I'm talking supersonic speeds. I want bits of our hull flying off because we're going so fast!
Very inspiring, Audacieux, but you have to let me give the commands.
Would you have given a different command, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: No, but that's far from the point.
I probably would've worded it differently.
What if I said yes?

Fields.DialogueText: Then I fail to see the point.
You mean less spirited and inspiring?
Then I'd be surprised. Why would you want us moving at a snail's pace?
It shouldn't matter who gives the command, as long as it's the right command.
Then why are you always the one to give the commands?
I'm just faster than you.
Speaking of fast, at our current speeds, we'll be surrounded by Morganas before we know it.
Well, that's what we want, isn't it? We need to catch O'Brien before he reaches his destination.
You're right. I just hope our engines can handle this.
These speeds are nothing for me. I was built to handle all this and more.
*ALARM*
One thing I can say for sure is that there's no breaking your confidence, Audacieux.
@BATTLE
Ne gomprenan ket. We're slowing down. Why are we slowing down!?
We're approaching dangerous waters. Dangerous waters that happen to be swarming with Morganas. We're not heading in without a plan.
But we're so close! We can't just stop here and let him get to his Morgana overlords.

Fields.MenuText: Then help me come up with a plan.
Stomping on the ground isn't going to get us going any quicker.
If you keep the tantrum up, I'll turn this ship around just to teach you a lesson.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't need to come up with a plan. The plan is obvious.
Then maybe I should stomp on your foot instead.
You wouldn't dare. There's no way you'd let a criminal go just to scold me.
As soon as we get the ship moving again, the plan should be to swoop in, take him down, and get out. Simple.
And what about all the other Morganas that would doubtless attack us as soon as we entered the area?
Well, we destroy them, obviously. I didn't think I needed to go into every small detail like that.
I have a feeling this is going to get dangerous if we do it your way.
We've met, right? Don't you think I can handle a little danger?
*ALARM*
I think you can handle a lot of danger.
@BATTLE
Finally, we're on the move again. Took you long enough, Capitaine.
We weren't stopped for that long. You're being dramatic.
Do we have to be moving so slowly? We've got to catch up to O'Brien more than ever now.
You know what would slow us down even more than this pace? Crashing into rocks.
Hmmm... Ya. Fine. You have a small, almost insignificant point.
Thank you. I'll take it.
Shh...
What is it?
I can feel Morganas all around us. You were right about moving slowly. We're not being noticed. Mostly.

Fields.MenuText: You actually admitted I was right. That's a first.
Mostly? What do you mean by that?
All around us, huh? We should be on alert at all times while we're here.

Fields.DialogueText: I've admitted you were right before. Inwardly.
Some Morganas are looking our way. Whether they're getting ready to attack... I'm not sure.
High alert. We don't want the Morganas catching us with our pants down.
How confident are you that we can handle this?
*ALARM*
Never mind.
Oh, don't overreact. If we take this group out quickly, we should be good for a while. We should just try not to make too much noise.
Easier said than done.
@BATTLE
This is a lot worse than I was expecting.
What were you expecting while in Morgana territory? Sunshine and rose petals?
I wasn't expecting so many places from which the Morganas could ambush us. I don't always sense every Morgana, but I can't help but feel like there's a dozen eyes on me at all times.

Fields.MenuText: Are you admitting we may have bitten off more than we could chew?
There are always more than a dozen eyes on you. You're quite stunning.
You're not wrong. I keep seeing Morganas around every corner.

Fields.DialogueText: Nann, I can definitely handle this. It just may require more effort than I first thought.
Compliments? I mean, you're right, but what are you trying to get from me, Capitaine?
That's good to hear. I mean, it's not, but I'm glad I'm not just going crazy or something.
Audacieux, you've been on watch for some time now. I think-
Hold that thought, Capitaine. There's a Morgana group on approach. We're not going to be able to avoid this one.
Another one? Let's do this quick and quiet then. You think you're capable of that?
What are you trying to say? I'm very quick.
That wasn't the part I was wondering about.
@BATTLE
Something's been nagging at me, Audacieux.
Ya? What's on your mind, Capitaine?
How did O'Brien get his hands on those plans? For the longest time, I thought I just left them on my desk or something. But I could've sworn you were the last to have them.
So what? You think I just gave them to him? That I told him to put them somewhere secure while I sunbathed? Is that what you're accusing me of?

Fields.MenuText: Well, it is now.
No, of course not. I know you wouldn't do something like that.
It was just a question. No reason to overreact if you're innocent.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I said too much, didn't I?
Ya... Of course I wouldn't do something so irresponsible...
Well, I am not...
I made a mistake, Capitaine. I passed off a responsibility that I should've taken more seriously.
I didn't realize how important they were until afterwards. And by then it was too late.
How did you let this happen, Audacieux? Were you really in that much of a hurry to get a tan?
That, and a few other things that I thought were more important. This is really hard for me to admit, but I was wrong.
Look at that. Hearing those words might make this whole thing worth it.
You're going to hold this over me now, aren't you?
I wouldn't dream of it. Certainly not during a battle.
@BATTLE
Hold! That's not a Morgana ship over there!
What? Where? That small thing surrounded by debris? You really think he'd be dumb enough to head into Morgana-infested waters on that dingy thing?
Here. Take a look for yourself.
Hmph, let's see here. Ooh, that is not a pretty sight.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, sorry, I should've warned you.
You think that's bad? I've seen way worse.
That's it? I was hoping for a bigger reaction. Like a shriek or something.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd appreciate that in future, thank you.
Well, so have I, obviously. It was just a little startling.
You were trying to shock me, Capitaine? It's going to take a lot more than that to get a scream out of me!
So. He's dead. What does that mean for us?
I take it as good news. If he died at sea, he probably didn't get a chance to do anything with the plans he stole.
Unless the Morganas took them when they killed him.
It's worth worrying about - but I don't think it's likely. The swarms they use to disassemble destroyed ships aren't exactly designed to carry paper.
You never know. Anything could happen.
We won't know for sure until we get those plans back in our hands. We need to send a team to O'Brien's ship.
Before that, we have more pressing matters. I'm afraid the Morganas might've used this as a trap.
They're closing in on us, I take it?
Ya. They know we're here, and they're doing something about it.
Then let's do something ourselves.
@BATTLE
What's the situation, Audacieux?
We have the plans back, but we're surrounded on all sides. It's like every Morgana in the area can smell us or something.
Is this a conversation we should have in private? I don't want to have to call a special assembly to address rumors about the ship being doomed.
What? Nann. We're not doomed.
Or just lightly doomed at worst.
Now's not the time for jokes. It's the time for action. I'm not about to let a bunch of Morganas end me here. So that means we can't give up! Do you hear me?

Fields.MenuText: I hear you. You have a plan?
Are you really complaining that this death isn't glorious enough for you?
Goes without saying. I'm still wondering if this was a trap all along, though. Was O'Brien a puppet or something?

Fields.DialogueText: "Plan" is a strong word, but I have inklings. I know if we work together we can come up with something.
For me or for you. We're not dying today. That's that!
A very good question that we can worry about when we're out of this!
Capitaine, now is not the time for you to be late giving these orders, because... I don't know what we're going to do. I can't give them for you.
Finally, you're letting me give the orders! Okay, we're surrounded on all sides, so we can't just run. We'll have to choose one direction and fight through anything in our way.
What direction?
Whichever one has the fewest Morganas, obviously.
@BATTLE
I am afraid that we may have picked the wrong direction.
@BATTLE
How close are we to getting out of this hellhole?
Not as close as we'd like. It would've taken us less time if we'd gone the other direction.
Then why didn't you say that before?
I didn't want to interrupt you right after I told you to give the orders. I didn't want to seem "discourteous" or anything.

Fields.MenuText: You have a point. That would've seemed a little rude.
I think cheeky fits you better.
Now you're keeping quiet? You have horrible timing.

Fields.DialogueText: I figured you'd think that. So I just followed your lead.
You remembered? Heh, I'm glad.
Oh? I'm sorry. Should I just seal my mouth shut so you never have to worry about what I have to say again!?
Audacieux, no matter what I've said in the past, or will say in the future, I want you to know that I value your opinion.
As loud as you can be, I always want to hear what you're thinking. Understand?
Ya, Capitaine. I was just... I was little worried I was starting to annoy.
You're not. Well... you are annoying sometimes, but in a good way.
I think that was supposed to be a compliment, so trugarez. Thank you.
Da netra. Now, back to the matter at hand. It's too late to turn around, so we just have to keep going. Do you agree?
It'd be far too dangerous to turn around now. We're dragging a lot of Morganas behind us.
Then forward it is.
Wait... What do you mean by "as loud as I can be?!"
We'll just have to make it the right one, won't we?
Capitaine, I have a bad feeling.
Is it just a general recognition of a bad situation or are you sensing something specific?
Something big is chasing us. Something bigger than we've ever faced.

Fields.MenuText: It couldn't just be a bunch of tiny ones? Perhaps in a trench coat?
Right. I don't like the idea of letting it herd us along. Opinions on turning around and engaging head-on?
At least it's behind us. All the more reason to move forward.

Fields.DialogueText: What? No! Where would Morganas even get a trench coat that size?
No! This is not the time to rush in. We should keep running.
Exactly. I just hope there isn't anything worse ahead of us.
I am the last person to admit something like this, Capitaine, but... I'm scared.
It's okay to be afraid. It doesn't make you a coward, it makes you human.
I'm a Belle.
You still get afraid. The important part is what you do with that fear. And today, we embrace that fear and run.
I never realized you were so... wait, what?
If that thing's as big as you say it is, it's burning a ridiculous amount of fuel. If we can outpace it until its tanks are empty, we're in a much better position to bring it down.
If this was a less dangerous situation, I'd drink to that, but it's not. So for now, I'll just crank up the engines to get us the hell out of here.
There are more Morganas to the east of us, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
We've put a lot of distance between the Morganas and us. We might finally have time to catch our breath.
We're still in their waters. They won't give up until they're making us their lunch. We need to keep pushing.

Fields.MenuText: I give the orders here, Audacieux.
If we keep running the crew ragged, we might have a mutiny on our hands.
You sound sure.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya. I'd give you a lot more grief if they were bad orders, though.
They wouldn't mutiny just because I'm trying to keep them from becoming Morgana chow. They're not that stupid!
I've never been more certain about anything in my life. Ever.
Capitaine, if we don't keep moving as fast as we can, the Morganas will be on us before you can say, "You were right, Audacieux."
Fine. Push those engines. We're running 'til we drop.
Trugarez, Capitaine. Thank you.
Well, let's get further to the west of them.
Capitaine! The engines are starting to give! I think I pushed them too hard.
Are you being serious right now? This isn't some stupid joke or something?
I don't make jokes! If we keep going at this pace, we'll be dead in the water. Literally, when the Morganas catch up to us.
How bad is it? How many Morganas do we have on our tail?
Too many to handle on our own.
Wait... Look there. That's not a Morgana ship.
Who is that? They're sending us a message. They heard our call for aid? What call for aid?
It was a Hail Mary. I didn't think anything would get through.
Well, your Hail Mary worked. They're offering their assistance with these Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Let them know how beaten up we are.
Be sure to warn them about the numbers you're sensing.
Let them know we're ready and willing.

Fields.DialogueText: They're saying they'll be sure to cover us.
They say they picked it up too. They're ready for it.
They received the message. Looks like we should get ready to fight.
*BOOM*
They there are. The Morganas have joined the party.
It might not be here yet, but don't forget there's a huge one heading our way.
I haven't forgotten, but we're not alone now. We can take her.
I think you're right. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
When did you have time to call for aid?
While you were focusing on wringing out the engines for all they're worth.
Why didn't you tell me?
Because I didn't think it would amount to anything. And, honestly, because I wasn't in the mood for an argument about bringing in outsiders on something you wanted to do yourself.
Well... ya, that argument probably would have happened. And I obviously would have won. So I'm glad you did it without my permission.

Fields.MenuText: I'm the captain. I don't actually need your permission.
Oh, phew, I almost didn't do it because I was scared you'd rip my head off.
Me too. That was a really close call.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not, but you should still want it. I am the ship, after all.
Okay, wait a minute. I'm willing to admit that I may be loud sometimes, but I'm certainly not scary!
It was. If the reinforcements hadn't come when they did... I don't want to think about it.
This doesn't give you permission to start doing more things behind my back.
I wouldn't dream of it.
That's good. If this partnership is going to work, we're going to need total trust.
Do you trust me?
I'm getting there.
Same.
@BATTLE
Audacieux, look what I snagged from port!
Booze? Is there some kind of special occasion I'm forgetting about?
We survived. That's a special enough occasion for me.
You've convinced me. Let me grab some glasses.
It usually takes a lot more to convince you of anything.
Well, I was actually really in the mood for a drink.
We have to make a toast. It's basically required. So what are we toasting to?

Fields.MenuText: To us!
To surviving!
To alcohol!

Fields.DialogueText: To a grand partnership that they'll tell tales of throughout the ages!
To looking death in the eyes and making him blink!
To forgetting our troubles and the headache we'll have in the morning!
You said it way better than I could've.
Not just louder?
Definitely not.
Trugarez, Capitaine. Now let's get a few more glasses. You're not leaving here until that bottle is empty.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: That makes a lot more sense.
I hope you don't mind if I just drink orange juice. One of us should probably still be able to stand in an hour.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya, ya. As long as you drink something!
Audacieux! Again with the nudity? Didn't we talk about this?
I'm not naked, I'm just topless. I wasn't planning on evening out my bottom half until-

Fields.MenuText: You know what, maybe don't. I actually hear that tan lines are in.

Fields.DialogueText: You are absolutely precious sometimes, Capitaine. Watching you get all flustered is a highlight of my day.
That makes one of us.
Aw, if you can't even look at me, how do you expect to make me stop?
I don't need to have my eyes open to wrap you in a fire blanket or something.
Ooh, I'm that smoldering?

Fields.MenuText: Enough teasing. Just put on some clothes before the Morganas see you.
Yes, but that's beside the point. Come on, there's Morganas waiting for us somewhere out there.

Fields.DialogueText: Let me be the judge of what's fashionable.

Fields.MenuText: Until?

Fields.DialogueText: Why? Need something to look at?

Fields.MenuText: The crew are going to talk.

Fields.DialogueText: Let them talk. They're used to Belles. They can be used to their bodies.
Let them look. They can see something beautiful before I put out their eyes.
Oh, come on. Morganas? Again?
Can't a captain just step out onto the deck once in a while to take in the... view....
@BATTLE
